head.title: Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. - Page #26

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #26 of 71 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Remarks & occurrences on Board the Nancy hired Transport on her return passage to Makinac or St Josephs in the month of October 1813[.]

nothing but shoals & Islands as far as the eye could carry – the lands bore & run from us NNW & S½W & to appearance level intersected with bays, or channels, round, Islands, at 6 PM wind at NW by W & moderate, the Vessel still continues to roll & pitch very much at ½ past 7 a heavy squall from the NW accompanied with hail which continues about a ¼ of an hour – latter part of the night strong gusts of wind & hail – very pierceing cold winds[.]

First part of this 24 hours wind variable from NNW to NW with intervals of squalls – at 4 AM hove in some of the best bower, clear & very cold weather – at noon still cold & serene men employed & sundry jobs repairing damages done in the gale – a canoe with 3 Indians come along side hoisted the colours make out from them that we are in the neighbourhood of La Closhe about 80 miles from the rappids of River St Clair – at 2 PM wind still continues from the NNW with clear pleasant weather the sea abates considerably – at 4 light airs & variable from the Westward loosed the Top sails & main sail & shook the reefs out of all but the fore top sail kept one in it from its being very bad in the head at ½ past 6 a fresh breeze at SE hove up & made all sail course West at 8 wind hauls to S SW (previous to looseing sails, hove up the small bower find it very much chaffed by the rocks, the bottom is of lime stone cast, & from appearances sharp rocks) cloudy to the Westwards, stowed the anchors & coiled such part of the cables as were dry below – wind freshens at 8 took in main T: G: sail at 10 the fore one, wind encreases.

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
